revised_title: Foot-and-Mouth Disease: Historical Overview and Advances in Understanding
tldr: This lecture reviews the history of foot-and-mouth disease, from its first description in 1546 to the present day, and highlights the developments in our understanding of the causal agent, a virus belonging to the family Picornaviridae. The impact of this knowledge on controlling the disease and future research is discussed, including the importance of vaccination and the potential for a more stable, synthesized vaccine.
